date: July 2009  State governments, meanwhile, are responsible for the construction and maintenance of most highways. State, county, or city governments play the leading role in financing and operating public schools. Local governments are primarily responsible for police and fire protection.Citation needed
accessdate: 2008-11-17    The federal government's debt rose by almost $1.4 trillion in 2009, and now stands at $12.1 trillion.   While the U.S. public debt is the world's largest in absolute size, another measure is its size relative to the nation's GDP. As of 2009 the debt was 83 percent of GDP. This debt, as a percent of GDP, is still less than the debt of Japan (192 percent) and roughly equivalent to those of a few western European nations.<ref name
